executiveSummary: Meg Meer and her husband Matt pitched their company 'The Bear and The Rat', a maker of frozen yogurt treats for dogs, seeking $125,000 for 20% equity. Despite strong enthusiasm and early distribution through Whole Foods and Petco, the Sharks declined to invest due to low sales ($30,000 in a year) and an overvalued company valuation.
nextSteps: Founders will continue building their brand, refining valuation, and expanding retail distribution for their dog treat products after receiving feedback from the investors.
